title: Cost Allocation
content:
To view the Cost Allocation menu items in Financial management, make sure that the tenant admin turns on Enable expense line in Administration > Configuration > Application Settings.

You can configure a cost allocation rule to generate one or more expense lines automatically. The following types of cost allocation rules are supported:

  • Expense allocation, debit expense lines are generated for each record.
  • Chargeback allocation, debit expense lines and credit expense lines are generated for each record. 

To make cost allocation rules work, you must first create the following financial metadata:

  • A fiscal year. For details, see Create a fiscal year record.
  • An accounting period. For details, see Create an accounting period record. 
  • A cost center. For details, see Create a cost center record.
  • A cost type. For details, see Create a cost type record.

By default, you can create cost allocation rules for the following record types:

  • Contract
  • Device
  • License
  • Infrastructure & Peripheral
  • Subscription (chargeback allocation rule only)

Out-of-the-box business rules are provided for these record types to specify when to trigger or stop the generation of Expense Lines.

Be aware that the solution currently has a limitation on how many cost allocation rules based requests can be executed in a given time. This is referred to as a rate limit, with the current system configuration as follows:

  • A maximum of 1000 requests to generate Expense Lines will be executed every 1 minute
  • A maximum of 6000 requests to generate Expense Lines will be executed every 1 hour

The rate limit is applied on a per tenant basis and any request above the rate limit is dropped. The dropping of requests is written into the logs.

The tenant admin can add more record types to the support list in a Dev tenant. Make sure the following fields are available on these record types:

  • Amount
  • Currency
  • Cost center
  • Cost type
  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Lists.
  2. In the Lists pane on the left, select CostAllocationRuleEntityType.
  3. In the right pane, click + Add, enter the record type name and display name, click OK.
  4. Click Save.

After additional record types are added to CostAllocationRuleEntityType list, define the list for expense allocation and chargeback allocation respectively.

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Studio.
  2. Select Cost allocation from the drop-down box at the top of the screen and select the Processes and Rules tab.
  3. Expand Rendering forms on the right, locate the Define suggested values for... process event, edit the values for expense allocation and chargeback allocation as needed.
